trans-unit.source: A track represents a single piece of music. Depending on the usage of the track model it can be either used as a stand-alone representation of a music track (like a single) or as a part of an album and/or part of a recording. Stand-alone If used stand-alone the track can have a download relation if a download link for that track exists. Part of an album If used as part of an album the relation to the download model should not be set as the download relation is being managed through the album model instead. Part of a recording If used as part of a recording the relation to the download model should not be set as the download relation is being managed through the recording model instead.
The date when the track has been released
Although the release date field contains date and time the time part is not taken into account when being displayed in the frontend.
You can highlight a track with a NEW badge by enabling this option.

You can highlight a track with a FEATURED badge by enabling this option. This will also show this track in a list of tracks having the FEATURED option enabled when using a plugin set to show only FEATURED tracks.
Add one or more download options for this track

You can add one or more download options for a track. You should only use this feature on stand-alone tracks not associated to an album or a recording unless the track should still be considered stand-alone and has a separate download.
Associate the track to an album
If the track is part of an album you can set this association here.
Associate the track to a recording
If the track is part of a DJ set you can attach it to a recording that is part of that particular DJ set.
